items.abstract: <jats:p>In the title complex salt, (C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>[ZnCl<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>], the Zn<jats:sup>II</jats:sup>cation is coordinated by four chloride ligands in a distorted tetrahedral geometry. The organic cations and complex anions are connected by N—H...Cl hydrogen bonds, leading to the formation of a three-dimensional network. The title complex salt was synthesized by the reaction of sodium azide, pyridine-2-carbonitrile and ZnCl<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>in aqueous solution. The salt was characterized by elemental analysis and IR and UV–Vis spectroscopy.</jats:p>
title: A simple and safe method for the preparation of bis[2-(2H-tetrazol-5-yl)pyridinium] tetrachloridozincate(II)

items.abstract: The solvothermal synthesis and crystal structures of a new class of luminescent inclusion double salts, exhibiting d10–d10 and d10–d5 metallophilicity, of the formula [Cu2(dih)2]2[Cu(4−y)MyCl8], where M is either Cu+ or heterometal of valency y (in this paper Mn2+ or La3+), are reported.
title: Templated metalophilicity: synthesis of halometallic double salts directed by a dicopper(i) hydrazinyl-tetraimine nanocation

items.abstract: <jats:p>The title compound, [Cu(C<jats:sub>9</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>8</jats:sub>BrClNO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>], is a square-planar complex. The potentially tridentate dibasic 2-bromo-4-chloro-6-{[(2-hydroxyethyl)imino]methyl}phenolate ligand coordinates in a<jats:italic>trans</jats:italic>-bis fashion to the Cu<jats:sup>II</jats:sup>centre<jats:italic>via</jats:italic>the imine N and phenolate O atoms. The Cu<jats:sup>II</jats:sup>atom lies on the centre of inversion of the molecule. The potentially coordinating hydroxyethyl group remains protonated and uncoordinated, taking part in intermolecular hydrogen bonds with vicinal groups, leading to the formation of a two-dimensional hydrogen-bond network with sheets parallel to the (10\overline{1}) plane. Substituent effects on the crystal packing and coordination modes of the ligand are discussed.</jats:p>
title: Disentangling steric and electronic factors in monomeric bis(2-bromo-4-chloro-6-{[(2-hydroxyethyl)imino]methyl}phenolato-κ2N,O)copper(II)
